# isGeodesic

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value specifying whether SceneKit uses a geodesic polygon mesh to render the sphere.

## Declaration

```swift
var isGeodesic: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], specifying that SceneKit constructs a sphere mesh using a rectangular grid, like the lines of latitude and longitude on a globe of the Earth. This type of sphere mesh is efficient for most uses, but can cause texture distortion in the areas near its poles.

A value of [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] specifies that SceneKit constructs a sphere mesh by successively subdividing an icosahedron, creating a grid of uniformly sized triangles across the entire surface of the sphere, as shown below.



## Adjusting Geometric Detail

- **segmentCount**: A number determining the detail of the polygon mesh SceneKit uses to render the sphere. Animatable.
